result.execSummary:
Jeffry James Simonds was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jeffry James Simonds was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffry James Simonds

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 10:08 AM 
Defendant Jeffry James Simonds not in court.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 
The Court has learned that Mr. Simonds is no longer in the Jefferson County Jail; directs case be closed. 

recess: 10:09am
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:39pm 
Defendant Jeffry James Simonds appears in court, in custody. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Mr. Simonds verifies name and date of birth
Right to Counsel reviewed. 

The Court finds Defendant competent to represent himself; further that waiver of counsel is being made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.

The Court finds that the Defendant is the same as charged in the complaint. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is a fugitive of justice. 

The Defendant has signed Waiver of Extradition paperwork. 
The Court orders Defendant committed to Jefferson County Jail not to exceed 30 days to allow time for requesting State to be picked up on warrant. 
recess 1:45  pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on 10/3/22 at 10:30am
JEFFRY SIMONDS USC and COR for extradition
